title: To all those new support players out there(Word from a sup main)
body: Plz, at least press your shields on your carries not you when you're not even exposed to the enemy.

replies.body:
> Plz, at least press your shields on your carries not you when you're not even exposed to the enemy.

One thing that newer players (and even veteran players sometimes) struggle with is remembering to use actives. If you've played support, you'll know that probably all of your items are going to be actives with the exception of your boots. It takes a little while for people to build good habits but they eventually get there with practice. Just kindly remind people at the beginning of the game to use actives, ping enemies missing and keep the map warded. Teamwork OP.

That is just not what's happening. We're trying to shield the damage before the skillshot hits them, it's just that our reaction time is trash so in most cases the shield comes after the damage.

Well, probably a bit of both depending on the situation and the elo. I have a somewhat unfortunate bronze friend who I've been on voice comms with as they supported me, and the not-even-thinking-to-shield-until-too-late situation is definitely real, although I'm sure many people will just be slow as they acclimatize to actually having a shield in the first place although their reaction times may be lacking.

Certainly some skill shots are pretty quick and hard to react to and I can hardly blame them, but theres plenty of people who aren't used to having shields who end up using them as a 'woah don't die' button, and not a 'prevent damage in the first place' button.

Hmm, that's actually true now that I think about a bit more. I remember when I first started playing Karma and the first few games I wasn't very accustomed to having a fail safe in the form of a shield, I'd completely forget to E myself a lot of the time instead just popping right as I'm about to die.

I play with quick/self cast on, so sometimes if I misclick or lag-click on the ground instead of on the ally, I'll end up shielding myself instead. I'd wager most of the times when supports shield themselves, it's because of the same reason.
I've shielded a lot of minions this way. (>_>)

As someone who plays Ivern a lot, I try to shield allies all the time. Sometimes during team fights though, it gets a bit messy and I miss the shield that was suppose to go on the adc, and instead it winds up on our Cho, or myself, though if I have Daisy out, I normally shield her because oh how I use her to constantly apply the pressure during, or after a team fight. Actives are something I'm still getting used to though. Have been playing for 3 years now and I still sometimes forget about the actives on items other than redemp, and hourglass.
Fun fact: Casting an ability like a shield while hovering your mouse over an allied champ portrait on the hud casts it on the ally whose portrait you were hovering.

I used to be super guilty of this as well, I got a gaming mouse and hot keyed all my item slots to it which has helped me a great deal.

My current pet peeve is when ADCs don't pay attention to when your using relic line and have maxed charges, if your not cooling down on at 1 charge then your income is slowed, I have found pinging max charges then pinging the minion I intend to take helps sometimes. Also annoyed when Supports build relic and just sit there max charges and I'm leaveing them easy cs to grab but they are ignoring it for the exact same reason.
